label: 八講会
本: The Clear Mirror:  A Chronicle of Japanese Court During the Kamakura Period, (1185-1333) . Stanford University Press . 1998
説明文: A service celebrating the Lotus Sutra. It was divided into eight sessions, one for each book of the sutra; lasted four days; and sometimes involved as many as 60 clerical participants. The munificent offerings of the sponsor and others, which were presented on the fifth day, during a firewood procession" of monks and laymen, included "offering-branches" (hōmochi), gifts attached to gold and silver branches, sprays of flowers, etc. McCullough and McCullough 1980: 236n, 267n, 505n. [法華経] [捧物]"
